children.value: These advanced parameters give you more control over how your bot behaves. Please take the time to understand how these parameters work before risking extensive capital with bots that utilize them.
There are two ways to configure these parameters:
to see the current strategy settings. Run command
Outside of the Hummingbot client, you can edit the strategy configuration file directly using a text editor and then import it later.
Set the number of order levels to place for each side of the order book.
Set and maintain a target inventory split between base and quote assets.
Set the duration of how long to wait before placing the next set of orders in case at least one of your orders gets filled.
If enabled, the orders on the side opposite to the filled orders remains active.
Set the minimum spread value for active orders to be canceled when the spread falls below this value.
Set the spread (from mid price) to defer order refresh process to the next cycle.
Place only sell orders when mid price goes above this price.
Set the buy and sell orders to be place alternately.
Set bid and ask order prices to be adjusted based on the current top bid and ask prices in the market.
If enabled, the transaction costs are added to the order price calculation.
If enabled, set external pricing source for the mid price.
Set and customize how Hummingbot creates orders in terms of order levels, size, and spread.
Set the duration of the maximum age of the order, and it will be refreshed depending on the value set.
export const _frontmatter = {"title":"Overview","description":"Learn how to use advanced market making strategies"}
